intro: Chiococca racemosa var. laxiflora, commonly known as the loose-flowered chiococca, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptic to ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The loose-flowered chiococca is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as rainforests or undergrowth.
